subject: Re: Need someone to take over the news
msgSnippet: ... help ... gets ... Paul, It could be me.  It s such a great service, I d hate to see it die. But quite understand if you can t fit it in. But some technical
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
> Hi group,
>
> I need someone else to take over the generation of the news. I will
help
> that person set up the news software so that the news automatically
gets
> generated, as it does now.
>
> Paul
>

Paul,

It could be me. It's such a great service, I'd hate to see it die.
But quite understand if you can't fit it in.

But some technical questions before I formally put my hand up:

1. Is the software all in Python, and can the generator thus be on any
platform?

2. What are the hardware requirements? Quite modest, I suppose?

3. And lastly I suppose I'd need an internet connection that is
(almost) always on? How frequently do you generate?

4. (The big one) How much time do you spend maintaining the generator?
I'm really just referring to keeping it running, not to making
enhancements.

Perhaps we should move this discussion over to the read_alphabet_tech
group?

Anthony Hagan
